net.markenwerk.utils.text.indentation

Class AbstractIndentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.text.indentation.AbstractIndentation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Indentation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WhitespaceIndentation

    public abstract class AbstractIndentation
extends Object
implements Indentation
    An AbstractIndentation is an Indentation that repeats a given indentation string.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface net.markenwerk.utils.text.indentation.Indentation

        DEFAULT, INVISIBLE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendTo(Appendable appendable, int level)
      Appends the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level, to the given Appendable
      void appendTo(Appendable appendable, int level, boolean includeLineBreak)
      Appends the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level or the string that needs to be appended at the end of a line, with the result that the next line is indented by the given level, including the necessary line break characters, to the given Appendable.
      String get(int level)
      Returns the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level.
      String get(int level, boolean includeLineBreak)
      Returns the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level or the string that needs to be appended at the end of a line, with the result that the next line is indented by the given level, including the necessary line break characters.
      String getLineBreak()
      returns the line break string used by this Indentation.
      boolean isVisible()
      Returns whether this Indentation has any visible effect or if every indentation string is the empty string.

      • get

        public String get(int level)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Indentation
        Returns the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level.

        The result is never null, even if this Indentation is not visible.

        Specified by:
        get in interface Indentation
        Parameters:
        level - The indentation level.
        Returns:
        The indentation string.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given level is negative.

      • get

        public String get(int level,
                  boolean includeLineBreak)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Indentation
        Returns the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level or the string that needs to be appended at the end of a line, with the result that the next line is indented by the given level, including the necessary line break characters.

        The line break characters are omitted, if this Indentation is not visible.

        The result is never null, even if this Indentation is not visible.

        Specified by:
        get in interface Indentation
        Parameters:
        level - The indentation level.
        includeLineBreak - Whether to include the line break characters.
        Returns:
        The indentation string.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given level is negative.

      • appendTo

                     int level)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     IOException
        Description copied from interface: Indentation
        Appends the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level, to the given Appendable
        Specified by:
        appendTo in interface Indentation
        Parameters:
        appendable - The Appendable to be used.
        level - The indentation level.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given Appendable is null or if the given level is negative.

      • appendTo

        public void appendTo(Appendable appendable,
                     int level,
                     boolean includeLineBreak)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     IOException
        Description copied from interface: Indentation
        Appends the string that needs to be appended at the beginning of a line, with the result that the the line is indented by the given level or the string that needs to be appended at the end of a line, with the result that the next line is indented by the given level, including the necessary line break characters, to the given Appendable.

        The line break characters are omitted, if this Indentation is not visible.

        Specified by:
        appendTo in interface Indentation
        Parameters:
        appendable - The Appendable to be used.
        level - The indentation level.
        includeLineBreak - Whether to include the line break characters.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given Appendable is null or if the given level is negative.
        IOException - If appending to the given Appendable failed.
